data.title: Off the hook
data.text: The food at the Oceanside location is great but this is the hallmark location.  The menu is eclectic and fantastic.  All of the pasta is handmade. The creativity in the kitchen is apparent by the daily specials.  Try the Dulac pork chop its delicious. The fritters are wonderful and if you are feeling adventurous try the grilled Octopus  salad.  The attention to service shows that the owner knows the importance of return customers.  Never a bad meal at this place!!

data.title: Scrummy!
data.text: Started out at the bar, talking to one of the owners and sommelier. We got this delicious steak and he paired an outstanding wine with it, and I must add that the martinis with the blue cheese stuffed olives we a huge hit. Great evening hotspot in Vista!

data.title: One of my daughters favorites
data.text: We went there on duel Birthdays and we were not the only ones. The Pork Shanks are the most tender, meaty, best I have ever had even compared to Germany.  They have inside and patio dinning( we sat outside).  This place is in downtown Vista, but parking is not a problem.  Really a great all around place to eat.

data.title: Nice Ambiance - Pricey
data.text:
Great ambiance, new restaurant (14 mos old). The restaurant appears to project themselves as a high end classy eatery and it failed miserably. At the prices they charge, I expected full and immediate service. Example; Waiter wasn't interested in our needs, or was not there when after completion of Appetizers nor our dinner. 

Menu was limited and simple. Although they had a limited selection of steaks their main thrust was bar type food. We choose a salad as an alternative to french fries and it was very vinegary and tasteless. After we completed dinner we ordered a Raspberry chocolate mouse that was comped by the manager after the waiter asked  why we did not eat the salad. BTW, they only offered the vinaigrette dressing, no other salad dressing was offered

data.title: Good food
data.text: Was here for a quick dinner. the food is great and well packaged, staff is friendly. The location is a little bit wired .. in a gas station. But you can take out your food and enjoy it at home :)

data.title: Interesting But Not Inspiring
data.text: Absolutely love the Oceanside restaurant but have been very disappointed in the new Vista location.  Food is not as good.  Too pricey for what you get.

data.title: Excellent pork chops!
data.text: Very nice place, good atmosphere, very friendly staff, good service and excellent food! We sat at the bar but the outside area looked very inviting.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: My wife and I went for the first time and can not wait to go back. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was delightful. Truly enjoyed our evening

data.title: Good atmosphere, good food, slow service.
data.text: We were quickly seated but it took a while for anyone to come bring us menus or water. Once we got the water half of ours had ice and half of our cups didn't? It took a while to get a hold of someone to get some more ice or water. All of our food was great. We ordered the burgers, a salad, and the chicken dish and everyone was happy. I will definitely visit again because the food was good and the atmosphere was nice on the patio.

data.title: Lunch spot
data.text: Love the interior and their bar, can sit inside or outside, has booths & tables, food is ok for lunch, doesn't have all the food choices from the restaurant in Oceanside but good lunch menu.  Nice place to have a long lunch & the street was just remodeled so the traffic and parking has been improved.

data.title: Looks can be deceiving
data.text: The Flying Pig looks like a biker bar set in a seedy section of Oceanside Do not let this keep you from going in.  The menu presented in old record jackets is inventive and the food excellently prepared.  Portions are large so order with this in mind.

data.title: Mrs.
data.text: Extra nice visit with Santa Barbsra friends. Patient wait staff, good friends, sitting on the patio with an ocean breeze.

data.title: Nice outdoor seating
data.text: I have been to both the Oceanside and Vista restaurants.   Parking was a problem at O,side but the food was good.   A little pricey !

data.title: Pigs Do Fly
data.text: Pigs do fly...right outta their kitchen.  The food at Flying Pig Pub and Kitchen is amazing.  Their location will surprise you because it is located out of a gas station...yup that's right - a gas station.  The food is strictly take out, however their food is amazing.  So if you want a quick, yummy meal this place is for you.  Just look for pink and black colors and a gas station.  Try it at least once....

data.title: Food not as good as Oceanside location
data.text: We love the Oceanide location of this restaurant and were excited to visit this new location.  It is larger, offers great open air seating, and a friendly staff.  Unfortunately the food missed the mark.  The Katsu has good meat, garnish, and sauce, but the flavors don't work together. My wife had the etouffee and described it as OK but not great. I think we will go to Oceanside for dinner where the food has never disappointed.  But the Vista location is great for drinks and maybe a burger.

data.title: Quality and inventive food options specializing in pork.
data.text: The atmosphere is friendly and cordial. Not any different than many other restaurants, but the open air seating adds some ambiance to the setting. The menu items specialize in pork, but the have other meat options as well. Sunday brunch is an especially good time to go as their unique menu options are at a premium. Couple the food with a decent draft beer selection from a variety of craft breweries and you've got the makings of a craft meal.

data.title: Good food - tough market to succeed in.
data.text:
We've been to both Flying Pig restaurants (Oceanside and now Vista) and there is no doubt that the food is top notch.   Farm to table fresh and this Flying Pig has a fabulous location along the newly opened Paseo Santa Fe in downtown Vista.  Excellent decor, inside, outside and bar seating, but I fear they'll be in for a tough row to hoe.  For it's location the beer offerings were lacking - a dozen beers to choose from but the restaurant is a stone's throw from two powerhouse performing breweries in the area.   

No doubt about it - THE FOOD IS FANTASTIC! But in 2016 that's expected.  I wish them luck but hopefully with their expanded liquor license they'll be able to draw large crowds into one of the best locations in downtown Vista.

data.title: good place to meet friends
data.text: As a long time Vista resident, I was pleasantly surprised by my first visit to the Flying Pig Pub.  I met a friend for happy hour.  Lisa,  our server, was cheerful and attentive.  I don't  drink wine or beer, but the selections were many.   The happy hour menu is limited, as is the happy hour itself, 4-5:00.  But what they had was delicious. We had the flavorful flatbread dish, the heirloom tomato salad, and the scrumptious tomato salad. I was surprised how the pub slowly filled up as it was a Wednesday evening.  I parked early to walk around Vista a bit, enjoying the sculptures, and taking in all the new pubs, and restaurants.

data.title: Mmmmm.... pork! and more!
data.text: Hubby and I popped out for a quick dinner, heard this place was good, decided to try. For some reason we were expecting bbq... it's not bbq. We started with the heirloom tomato salad - amazing!!!!! He chose the filet mignon, (not on the menu) and I went with our server's suggestion of the pork chop. Both were delicious. We'll share the leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Including a beer each and 20% tip our total was $120. Definitely more than we'd usually spend for a quick dinner out, but the food was phenomenal and the service excellent. We really liked the decor, too. Will definitely visit again.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: Our first visit to this location and we weren't  disappointed.  The service is top notch as is the beer selection.  The menu is broad enough and fits all tastes.  This is a true gastropub with a lot of imagination by the chef on the offerings and presentation.  The salads are great as is the pork chop and pork shank.  The burgers looked awesome. The steaks are cut in house and we heard others commenting on how good they were.  This location will have a full bar by the middle of June and that will only make it better
